title: Cat
text: The cat is a domestic species of small carnivorous mammal.

title: Cat
text: A cat can either be a house cat, a farm cat or a feral cat; the latter ranges freely and avoids human contact.

title: Cat
text: Domestic cats are valued by humans for companionship and their ability to hunt rodents. About 60 cat breeds are recognized by various cat registries.

title: Cat
text: The cat is similar in anatomy to the other felid species: it has a strong flexible body, quick reflexes, sharp teeth and retractable claws adapted to killing small prey.

title: Cat
text: Cat communication includes vocalizations like meowing, purring, trilling, hissing, growling and grunting as well as cat-specific body language.

title: Cat
text: A predator that is most active at dawn and dusk (crepuscular), the cat is a solitary hunter but a social species.

title: Cat
text: It can hear sounds too faint or too high in frequency for human ears, such as those made by mice and other small mammals.

title: Cat
text: Female domestic cats can have kittens from spring to late autumn, with litter sizes often ranging from two to five kittens.

title: Cat
text: Domestic cats are bred and shown at events as registered pedigreed cats, a hobby known as cat fancy.

title: Cat
text: Population control of cats may be effected by spaying and neutering, but their proliferation and the abandonment of pets has resulted in large numbers of feral cats worldwide.

title: Cat
text: Cats were first domesticated in the Near East around 7500 BC.

title: Cat
text: It was long thought that cat domestication began in ancient Egypt, where cats were venerated from around 3100 BC.

title: Cat
text: As of 2021, there are an estimated 220 million owned and 480 million stray cats in the world.
